s:CategoryScheme.s:Name: A category scheme of Eurostat's dataflows
s:CategoryScheme.s:Description: A scheme to group dataflows per domain as used by Eurostat. This version contains all STS related dataflows.

s:ConceptScheme.s:Name: Cross Domain Metadata Concepts
s:ConceptScheme.s:Description: Cross-domain concepts in the SDMX framework describe metadata concepts relevant to many statistical domains. SDMX recommends use of the concepts outlined below whenever feasible to promote re-usability and exchange of statistical information and their related metadata between national and international organisations.

s:Concept.s:Name: Accuracy
s:Concept.s:Description: Closeness of computations or estimates to the exact or true values that the statistics were intended to measure.

s:Concept.s:Name: Accuracy - overall
s:Concept.s:Description: Assessment of accuracy, linked to a certain data set or domain, which is summarising the various components into one single measure.

s:Concept.s:Name: Adjustment
s:Concept.s:Description: The set of procedures employed to modify statistical data to enable it to conform to national or international standards or to address data quality differences when compiling specific data sets.

s:Concept.s:Name: Adjustment - coded
s:Concept.s:Description: Type of adjustment used, represented by a code.

s:Concept.s:Name: Adjustment - detail
s:Concept.s:Description: Textual description of the type of adjustment used.

s:Concept.s:Name: Advance notice of changes in methodology
s:Concept.s:Description: Policy on notifying the public of changes in methodology, indicating whether the public is notified before a methodological change affects disseminated data and, if so, how long before.

s:Concept.s:Name: Age
s:Concept.s:Description: The length of time that a person has lived or a thing has existed.

s:Concept.s:Name: Base period
s:Concept.s:Description: The period of time used as the base of an index number, or to which a constant series refers.

s:Concept.s:Name: Civil status
s:Concept.s:Description: Legal, conjugal status of each individual in relation to the marriage laws or customs of the country.

s:Concept.s:Name: Classification system
s:Concept.s:Description: Arrangement or division of objects into groups based on characteristics which the objects have in common.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coherence
s:Concept.s:Description: Adequacy of statistics to be combined in different ways and for various uses.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coherence - internal
s:Concept.s:Description: Extent to which statistics are consistent within a given data set.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coherence - cross domain
s:Concept.s:Description: Extent to which statistics are reconcilable with those obtained through other data sources or statistical domains.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data collection
s:Concept.s:Description: Systematic process of gathering data for official statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Provision Agreement Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dataflow Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text.

s:Concept.s:Name: Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text which can be attached to data or metadata

s:Concept.s:Name: Group Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text.

s:Concept.s:Name: Observation Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text.

s:Concept.s:Name: Time-Series Comment
s:Concept.s:Description: Supplementary descriptive text.

s:Concept.s:Name: Comparability
s:Concept.s:Description: The extent to which differences between statistics can be attributed to differences between the true values of the statistical characteristics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Comparability - geographical
s:Concept.s:Description: Extent to which statistics are comparable between geographical areas.

s:Concept.s:Name: Comparability - over time
s:Concept.s:Description: Extent to which statistics are comparable or reconcilable over time.

s:Concept.s:Name: Completeness
s:Concept.s:Description: The extent to which all statistics that are needed are available.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data compiling agency
s:Concept.s:Description: The administrative unit compiling the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Confidentiality
s:Concept.s:Description: A property of data indicating the extent to which their unauthorised disclosure could be prejudicial or harmful to the interest of the source or other relevant parties.

s:Concept.s:Name: Confidentiality - status
s:Concept.s:Description: Information about the confidentiality status of the object to which this attribute is attached.

s:Concept.s:Name: Confidentiality - data treatment
s:Concept.s:Description: Rules applied for treating the data set to ensure statistical confidentiality and prevent unauthorised disclosure.

s:Concept.s:Name: Confidentiality - policy
s:Concept.s:Description: Legislative measures or other formal procedures which prevent unauthorised disclosure of data that identify a person or economic entity either directly or indirectly.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact
s:Concept.s:Description: Individual or organisational contact points for the data or metadata, including information on how to reach the contact points.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact fax number
s:Concept.s:Description: Fax number of the contact points for the data or metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact person function
s:Concept.s:Description: The area of technical responsibility of the contact, such as "methodology", "database management" or "dissemination".

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact mail address
s:Concept.s:Description: The postal address of the contact points for the data or metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact name
s:Concept.s:Description: The name of the contact points for the data or metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact organisation
s:Concept.s:Description: The name of the organisation of the contact points for the data or metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact phone number
s:Concept.s:Description: The telephone number of the contact points for the data or metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Cost and Burden
s:Concept.s:Description: Cost associated with the collection and production of a statistical product and burden on respondents.

s:Concept.s:Name: Cost and Burden - Efficiency management
s:Concept.s:Description: Cost benefit analysis, effectiveness of execution of medium term statistical programs, and ensuring efficient use of resources.

s:Concept.s:Name: Cost and Burden - Resources
s:Concept.s:Description: Staff, facilities, computing resources, and financing to undertake statistical production.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coverage
s:Concept.s:Description: The definition of the population that statistics aim to cover.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coverage - sector
s:Concept.s:Description: Main economic or other sectors covered by the statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coverage - Time
s:Concept.s:Description: The length of time for which data are available.

s:Concept.s:Name: Currency
s:Concept.s:Description: Monetary denomination of the object being measured.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data compilation
s:Concept.s:Description: Operations performed on data to derive new information according to a given set of rules.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data description
s:Concept.s:Description: Main characteristics of the data set described in an easily understandable manner, referring to the data and indicators disseminated.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data presentation
s:Concept.s:Description: Description of the disseminated data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data revision
s:Concept.s:Description: Any change in a value of a statistic released to the public.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data update
s:Concept.s:Description: The last date on which the data element was inserted or modified in the database.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data validation
s:Concept.s:Description: Process of monitoring the results of data compilation and ensuring the quality of the statistical results.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data validation - intermediate
s:Concept.s:Description: Validation that intermediate calculations leading to statistical outputs have been correctly done.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data validation - output
s:Concept.s:Description: Assessment of discrepancies and other problems in statistical outputs.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data validation - source
s:Concept.s:Description: Assessment of discrepancies and other problems related to source data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Decimals
s:Concept.s:Description: The number of digits of an observation to the right of a decimal point.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data dissemination agency
s:Concept.s:Description: The administrative unit that disseminates the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data presentation - disseminated detail
s:Concept.s:Description: Disseminated subdomain, measure, and time period breakdowns of statistics in the dataset.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format
s:Concept.s:Description: Media by which statistical data and metadata are disseminated.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format - other
s:Concept.s:Description: References to the most important other data dissemination done.

s:Concept.s:Name: Documentation on methodology
s:Concept.s:Description: Descriptive text and references to methodological documents available.

s:Concept.s:Name: Education level
s:Concept.s:Description: The highest level of an educational programme the person has successfully completed.

s:Concept.s:Name: Embargo time
s:Concept.s:Description: The exact time at which the data could be made available to the public.

s:Concept.s:Name: Frequency
s:Concept.s:Description: The time interval at which observations occur over a given time period.

s:Concept.s:Name: Frequency of data collection
s:Concept.s:Description: Frequency with which the source data are collected.

s:Concept.s:Name: Frequency detail
s:Concept.s:Description: A further specification of the frequency to include more detailed information about the type of frequency and frequencies not commonly used.

s:Concept.s:Name: Frequency of dissemination
s:Concept.s:Description: The time interval at which the statistics are disseminated over a given time period.

s:Concept.s:Name: Grossing / Netting
s:Concept.s:Description: Form of consolidation used in presenting the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Index type
s:Concept.s:Description: The type of index number used in the statistical production process.

s:Concept.s:Name: Institutional Mandate
s:Concept.s:Description: Set of rules or other formal set of instructions assigning responsibility as well as the authority to an organisation for the collection, processing, and dissemination of statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Institutional Mandate - legal acts and other agreements
s:Concept.s:Description: Legal acts or other formal or informal agreements that assign responsibility as well as the authority to an agency for the collection, processing, and dissemination of statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Institutional Mandate - data sharing
s:Concept.s:Description: Arrangements or procedures for data sharing and coordination between data producing agencies.

s:Concept.s:Name: Institutional Mandate - respondent relations
s:Concept.s:Description: Measures to encourage statistical reporting and/or to sanction non-reporting.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata last certified
s:Concept.s:Description: Date of the latest certification provided by the domain manager to confirm that the metadata posted are still up-to-date, even if the content has not been amended.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata last update
s:Concept.s:Description: Date of last update of the content of the metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata last posted
s:Concept.s:Description: Date of the latest dissemination of the metadata.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata update
s:Concept.s:Description: The date on which the metadata element was inserted or modified in the database.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format - microdata access
s:Concept.s:Description: Information on whether micro-data are also disseminated.

s:Concept.s:Name: Maintenance Agency
s:Concept.s:Description: The agency that maintains domain-specific data structure and metadata structure definitions.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format - News release
s:Concept.s:Description: Regular or ad-hoc press releases linked to the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Non-sampling error
s:Concept.s:Description: Error in sample estimates which cannot be attributed to sampling fluctuations.

s:Concept.s:Name: Observation Pre-break Value
s:Concept.s:Description: The observation, at a time series break period, that was calculated using the old methodology.

s:Concept.s:Name: Observation Status
s:Concept.s:Description: Information on the quality of a value or an unusual or missing value.

s:Concept.s:Name: Observation Value
s:Concept.s:Description: The value, at a particular period, of a particular variable.

s:Concept.s:Name: Occupation
s:Concept.s:Description: The definition of an occupation covers various jobs or positions which are held by individual workers who perform one or another of the possible combinations of the tasks described.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format - online database
s:Concept.s:Description: Information about on-line databases in which the disseminated data can be accessed.

s:Concept.s:Name: Contact organisation unit
s:Concept.s:Description: An addressable subdivision of an organisation

s:Concept.s:Name: Originator Data identifier
s:Concept.s:Description: The data identifier as found in the originating database.

s:Concept.s:Name: Professionalism
s:Concept.s:Description: Standard expected from a person who is well trained in a particular job.

s:Concept.s:Name: Professionalism - code of conduct
s:Concept.s:Description: Provision for assuring the qualifications of staff and allowing staff to perform their functions without intervention motivated by non-statistical objectives.

s:Concept.s:Name: Professionalism - impartiality
s:Concept.s:Description: Description of the elements providing assurances that statistics are produced on an impartial basis.

s:Concept.s:Name: Professionalism - methodology
s:Concept.s:Description: Describes the elements providing assurances that the choices of sources and statistical techniques as well as decisions about dissemination are informed solely by statistical considerations.

s:Concept.s:Name: Professionalism - statistical commentary
s:Concept.s:Description: Describes the elements providing assurances that the statistical entity is entitled to comment on erroneous interpretation and misuse of statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Dissemination format - Publications
s:Concept.s:Description: Regular or ad-hoc publications in which the data are made available to the public.

s:Concept.s:Name: Punctuality
s:Concept.s:Description: Time lag between the actual delivery of the data and the target date when it should have been delivered.

s:Concept.s:Name: Quality management - assessment
s:Concept.s:Description: Overall assessment of data quality, based on standard quality criteria.

s:Concept.s:Name: Quality assurance
s:Concept.s:Description: Guidelines focusing on quality in general and dealing with quality of statistical programmes, including measures for ensuring the efficient use of resources.

s:Concept.s:Name: Quality management - documentation
s:Concept.s:Description: Documentation on procedures applied for quality management and quality assessment.

s:Concept.s:Name: Quality management
s:Concept.s:Description: Systems and frameworks in place within an organisation to manage the quality of statistical products and processes.

s:Concept.s:Name: Recording basis
s:Concept.s:Description: Processes and standards employed in calculating statistical aggregates.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reference area
s:Concept.s:Description: The country or geographic area to which the measured statistical phenomenon relates.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reference period - Collection
s:Concept.s:Description: Dates or periods during which observations have been collected (such as middle, average or end of period) to compile the indicator for the target reference period.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reference Period
s:Concept.s:Description: The period of time or point in time to which the measured observation is intended to refer.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reference period - Target
s:Concept.s:Description: The period that the data is designed to represent.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reference period - Weights
s:Concept.s:Description: Dates or periods to which the observations used to compile the weights refer.

s:Concept.s:Name: Relevance
s:Concept.s:Description: The degree to which statistical information meets the real or perceived needs of clients.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release calendar access
s:Concept.s:Description: Access to the release calendar information.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release calendar
s:Concept.s:Description: The schedule of statistical release dates.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release policy - policy commentary
s:Concept.s:Description: Whether or not ministerial commentary is provided on the occasion of statistical release.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release policy
s:Concept.s:Description: Rules for disseminating statistical data to interested parties.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release policy - legal acts and other agreements
s:Concept.s:Description: Legal acts and other agreements pertaining to data access.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release policy - transparency
s:Concept.s:Description: Dissemination of the release policy to the public.

s:Concept.s:Name: Release policy - user access
s:Concept.s:Description: The policy for release of the data to users, the scope of dissemination (eg, to the public), how users are informed that the data are being released, and whether the policy provides for the dissemination of statistical data to all users at the same time. It also describes the policy for briefing the press in advance of the release of the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Reporting agency
s:Concept.s:Description: The administrative unit that supplies the data for a given instance of the statistics.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data revision - policy
s:Concept.s:Description: Policy aimed at ensuring the transparency of disseminated data, whereby preliminary data are compiled that are later revised.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data revision - practice
s:Concept.s:Description: Information on the data revision practice.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data revision - studies
s:Concept.s:Description: Information about data revision studies and analyses.

s:Concept.s:Name: Sampling
s:Concept.s:Description: The process of selecting a number of cases from all the cases in a particular group or universe.

s:Concept.s:Name: Sampling error
s:Concept.s:Description: That part of the difference between a population value and an estimate thereof, derived from a random sample, which is due to the fact that only a subset of the population is enumerated.

s:Concept.s:Name: Sex
s:Concept.s:Description: This concept is applied if data needs to be categorised by sex, where sex is "the state of being male or female".

s:Concept.s:Name: Source data
s:Concept.s:Description: Characteristics and components of the raw statistical data used for compiling statistical aggregates.

s:Concept.s:Name: Statistical concepts and definitions
s:Concept.s:Description: Statistical characteristics of statistical observations.

s:Concept.s:Name: Statistical population
s:Concept.s:Description: The total membership or population or "universe" of a defined class of people, objects or events.

s:Concept.s:Name: Statistical unit
s:Concept.s:Description: Entity for which information is sought and for which statistics are ultimately compiled.

s:Concept.s:Name: Supplementary data
s:Concept.s:Description: Data not routinely disseminated that are made available to users upon request.

s:Concept.s:Name: Timeliness
s:Concept.s:Description: Length of time between data availability and the event or phenomenon they describe

s:Concept.s:Name: Time format
s:Concept.s:Description: Technical format in which time is represented for the measured phenomenon.

s:Concept.s:Name: Timeliness - Output
s:Concept.s:Description: The lapse of time between the end of a reference period (or a reference date) and dissemination of the data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Time period
s:Concept.s:Description: The period of time or point in time to which the measured observation refers.

s:Concept.s:Name: Timeliness - Source data
s:Concept.s:Description: The time between the end of a reference period (or a reference date) and actual receipt of the data by the compiling agency.

s:Concept.s:Name: Title
s:Concept.s:Description: Textual label used as identification of a statistical object.

s:Concept.s:Name: Unit of measure
s:Concept.s:Description: The unit in which the data values are measured.

s:Concept.s:Name: Unit of measure detail
s:Concept.s:Description: Additional textual information on the unit of measure.

s:Concept.s:Name: Unit Multiplier
s:Concept.s:Description: Exponent in base 10 specified so that multiplying the observation numeric values by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the UNIT.

s:Concept.s:Name: Relevance - User Needs
s:Concept.s:Description: Description of users and their respective needs with respect to the statistical data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Relevance - User Satisfaction
s:Concept.s:Description: Measures to determine user satisfaction.

s:Concept.s:Name: Valuation
s:Concept.s:Description: The definition of the price per unit, for goods and services flows and asset stocks.

s:Concept.s:Name: Counterpart reference area
s:Concept.s:Description: The secondary area (as opposed to "reference area") to which the measured data is in relation.

s:ConceptScheme.s:Name: Eurostat (additional) concepts
s:ConceptScheme.s:Description: These concepts are defined in order to be used in Euro-SDMX MSD due to the fact that no relevant concept is defined in the Cross-Domain Concepts Scheme (CDC).

s:Concept.s:Name: Accessibility and clarity
s:Concept.s:Description: The conditions and modalities by which users can obtain, use and interpret data.

s:Concept.s:Name: Accessibility of documentation
s:Concept.s:Description: Accessibility of documentation

s:Concept.s:Name: Accuracy and reliability
s:Concept.s:Description: Accuracy: closeness of computations or estimates to the exact or true values that the statistics were intended to measure Reliability: closeness of the initial estimated value to the subsequent value.

s:Concept.s:Name: Asymmetry for mirror flow statistics - coefficient
s:Concept.s:Description: The difference or the absolute difference of inbound and outbound flows between a pair of countries divided by the average of these two values.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coherence - sub annual and annual statistics
s:Concept.s:Description: The extent to which statistics of different frequencies are reconcilable

s:Concept.s:Name: Coherence - National Accounts
s:Concept.s:Description: The extent to which statistics are reconcilable with National Accounts.

s:Concept.s:Name: Common units - proportion
s:Concept.s:Description: The proportion of common units covered by both the survey and the administrative sources in relation to the total number of units in the survey.

s:Concept.s:Name: Comparability - domain
s:Concept.s:Description: The extent to which statistics are comparable between statistical domains.

s:Concept.s:Name: Length of comparable time series
s:Concept.s:Description: The number of reference periods in time series from last break.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data completeness - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The ratio of the number of data cells provided to the number of data cells required.

s:Concept.s:Name: Coverage error
s:Concept.s:Description: Divergence between the frame population and the target population.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data tables - consultations
s:Concept.s:Description: Number of consultations of data tables within a statistical domain for a given time period displayed in a graph.

s:Concept.s:Name: Data revision - average size
s:Concept.s:Description: The average over a time period of the revisions of a key item. The 'revision' is defined as the difference between a later and an earlier estimate of the key item.

s:Concept.s:Name: Imputation - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The ratio of the number of replaced values to the total number of values for a given variable.

s:Concept.s:Name: Introduction
s:Concept.s:Description: A general description of the statistical process and its outputs, and their evolution over time.

s:Concept.s:Name: Item non-response - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The ratio of the in-scope (eligible) units which have not responded to a particular item and the in-scope units that are required to respond to that particular item

s:Concept.s:Name: Measurement error
s:Concept.s:Description: Error in reading, calculating or recording numerical value.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata completeness - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The ratio of the number of metadata elements provided to the total number of metadata elements applicable.

s:Concept.s:Name: Metadata - consultations
s:Concept.s:Description: Number of consultations within a statistical domain for a given time period.

s:Concept.s:Name: Model assumption error
s:Concept.s:Description: Error due to domain specific models needed to define the target of estimation.

s:Concept.s:Name: Non response error
s:Concept.s:Description: The difference between the statistics computed from the collected data and those that would be computed if there were no missing values.

s:Concept.s:Name: Over-coverage - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The proportion of units accessible via the frame that do not belong to the target population.

s:Concept.s:Name: Processing error
s:Concept.s:Description: The error in final data collection process results arising from the faulty implementation of correctly planned information methods.

s:Concept.s:Name: Punctuality - delivery and publication
s:Concept.s:Description: The number of days between the delivery/release date of data and the target date on which they were scheduled for delivery/release.

s:Concept.s:Name: Sampling error - indicators
s:Concept.s:Description: Precision measures for estimating the random variation of an estimator due to sampling.

s:Concept.s:Name: Seasonal adjustment
s:Concept.s:Description: The statistical technique used to remove the effects of seasonal calendar influences operating on a series.

s:Concept.s:Name: Statistical presentation
s:Concept.s:Description: Statistical presentation

s:Concept.s:Name: Statistical processing
s:Concept.s:Description: Statistical processing

s:Concept.s:Name: Time lag - final result
s:Concept.s:Description: The number of days (or weeks or months) from the last day of the reference period to the day of publication of complete and final results.

s:Concept.s:Name: Time lag - first result
s:Concept.s:Description: The number of days (or weeks or months) from the last day of the reference period to the day of publication of first results.

s:Concept.s:Name: Timeliness and punctuality
s:Concept.s:Description: Timeliness and punctuality

s:Concept.s:Name: Unit non-response - rate
s:Concept.s:Description: The ratio of the number of units with no information or not usable information to the total number of in-scope (eligible) units.

s:FullTargetIdentifier.s:Name: Full target identifier for the ESMS report
s:FullTargetIdentifier.s:Description: Full target identifier for the ESMS report

s:ReportStructure.s:Name: Euro-SDMX Metadata Structure (ESMS)
s:ReportStructure.s:Description: Structure of a report containing reference metadata (documentation) describing a set of statistical data originated by a specific data provider. The metadata report may describe a whole data domain, or a subset, or a table, depending on specific agreements concerning the exchange of information.
